intro: Pilosella cymosa subsp. origenes, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow disk flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is a perennial herb that produces numerous small, clustered flower heads, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
